author: Cathrine Daily
comment: Great app though not sure how to rearrange the cards. No sound with alerts or a way to change the vibration  to indicate it is something urgent.

author: Paul W
comment: Well  laid out, very readable.

author: Nate Peters
comment: Description of the Pro features is very misleading:  "Personalize your weather content with the Aeris Wear Pro upgrade! You'll have access to all 9 of our cards and the ability to customize your card order."  Once you upgrade to Pro you still do not have the option to change the first 3 cards. Wish my purchase was still within the refund window...

author: Steve Denney
comment: I do like this App with one exception, the 'Maps' don't work at all, the App just crashes, and has to be restarted. Considering I have the latest top of the range Sony Xperia XZ Premium (although it does not work on the Sony Xperia Z5 either) I wonder how it works at all on lesser spec'd machines.  UPDATE : Having got a reply from the developers today I looked at the app again on my phone, (the above problem was on the phone app) and for some reason (magic ?) it is working perfectly, so I then turned to my Sony Smartwatch 3 (it doesn't run Wear v2 by the way) and it works perfectly on that too.  I must admit I had not checked or used it since I first reported the problem, but all is well now and of course I have now given it the 5 stars it deserves. Thanks to the developer for the reply though - I do feel a little guilty for not checking it before now though although there has been no updates to Aeris, there have been a couple of Android updates, but it still remains a mystery as to why it didn't work initially.

reply.author: AerisWeather
reply.content:
Hi Steve,

If you run Android Wear v2, an updated Aeris Wear executable is available from the Play Store via the wearable (with Android Wear 2 the wearable app is no longer pushed from the phone).

Otherwise, our support team will be happy to help get you up and running. You can submit a ticket at: https://helpdesk.aerisweather.com 

Thanks!

author: Chaz Christensen
comment: Good app but I wish there was a little more information, like percent chance it'll rain. The radar takes forever to load too

author: Brett Connor
comment: Looks nice, reasonable features.  BUT very suspect why it wants access to contacts and phone though, and it doesn't start without these permissions.

author: Emily Papp Crofford
comment: Kept crashing after I denied the app's request to control phone calls. There's no reason a weather app needs that permission

reply.author: AerisWeather
reply.content:
Hi Emily,

The phone permission is needed in case you're using the app and the phone rings - the app needs to let the incoming call notification have control of your screen to switch to the call. 

Thanks for trying the app and I hope this helps explain the need for the phone permission.

author: Greg Eaton
comment: Congrats - Your radar doesn't work on Wear 2.0 Watch - It is a waste of time and paid for upgrade ??? Wow

reply.author: AerisWeather
reply.content:
Hi Greg,

When upgrading to Android Wear v2, a new Aeris Wear executable is required. It has to be pulled from the Android Wear Play Store via the wearable (with Android Wear 2 the wearable app is no longer pushed from the phone companion app). The team released an new update for v2 which is available from the Wear store now. 

Thanks!

author: Janet Fincannon
comment: help. cannot get to show on S2, which is why I wanted it. Does show on S8 phone. PLEASE help.

reply.author: AerisWeather
reply.content:
Hi Janet,

If you're running Android Wear v2, an updated Aeris Wear executable is available from the Play Store via the wearable (with Android Wear 2 the wearable app is no longer pushed from the phone).

Otherwise, our support team will be happy to help get you up and running. You can submit a ticket at: https://helpdesk.aerisweather.com 

Thanks!

author: Rick McBride
comment: Simply doesn't work. App indicates that there's no communication and retries continually. App on phone works fine.

reply.author: AerisWeather
reply.content:
Hi Rick,

If you run Android Wear v2, an updated Aeris Wear executable is available from the Play Store via the wearable (with Android Wear 2 the wearable app is no longer pushed from the phone).

Otherwise, our support team will be happy to help get you up and running. You can submit a ticket at: https://helpdesk.aerisweather.com 

Thanks!

comment: A bigger radar would be nice.

author: Rodrigo Viaud
comment: I love it

author: michael hester
comment: Great
I wish it was a free app for the iPhone great app

author: Kevin Thompson
comment: This is a great app for my LG watch however over the past month it has been closing every 1/2 hour. It is getting very tiresome. I'm not sure what is wrong, it worked fine on all my phones and after each update. Still a great app when working. Highly recommend.  Update : watch just updated to 2.0 and now the app has disappeared. Tried re-syncing but no luck.

reply.author: AerisWeather
reply.content:
Hi Kevin,

When upgrading to Android Wear v2, a new Aeris Wear executable is required. It has to be pulled from the Android Wear Play Store via the wearable (with Android Wear 2 the wearable app is no longer pushed from the phone companion app). The team released an new update for v2 which is available from the Wear store now. 

Thanks!

author: Kris Diehl
comment: I think it's probably the best Wear weather app- ease of use, most info, but despite being updated for 2.0, does not yet have a complication. PLEASE add!

author: Dylan Conley
comment: Got this for wear and app completely broke with android wear 2 update.

reply.author: AerisWeather
reply.content:
Hi Dylan,

Thanks for the feedback! The Android Team has released an update to address some of the concerns with Android Wear version 2. It is available via the Google Play Store now.

author: joshua spence
comment: Support address is incorrect.

author: Lee Dresser
comment: Was fine before I got 2.0 now the notification does not fit in a face.

reply.author: AerisWeather
reply.content:
Hi Lee,

The team pushed an update to Aeris Wear to address the changes in Android Wear v2. The update is live on the Google Play store now. 

Thanks!

author: Mud Man
comment: Paid for the customizable cards, but they are only available when thw watch updates at whatever time intervals are set in the app. I have a tendancy to close down the routine notifications on my watch. I don't want frequent notifications popping up on my watch. I want to open it manualy when I actually want to know about the weather. If you open the app on the watch manually, however. the customized screens added do not show up unfortunately.

reply.author: AerisWeather
reply.content:
Hello,

Thanks for the feedback! The team has released an update to the app which now makes the Pro views available from the wearable app as well in the notifications.

author: DeWayne Ferris
comment: After viewing Aeris Pulse and paying for Aeris Pro, I am disappointed that Pulse is not part of Pro. Pulse inclusion in Pro would make Pro a super big deal. Aeris 'free' is a good app. Pro is a really weak upgrade.
title: Aeris Pulse should be included in pro version

author: Todd Blumenauer
comment: Nice and simple with radar maps and follow your location, also works very well with my android wear watch . It also has severe weather alerts if you set it up in notifications .Very clean. Great app!

author: Charles Downs
comment: Too many times it times out trying to get the weather on my watch when I have full connectivity and internet. When it works, it is awesome.
title: Awesome... When it works

author: Andrew Damico
comment: Finally a weather app that is accurate for my watch. Like the looks of the cards. Just wish I could disable the notification so that it only pulls the weather when I open the app.
title: Accurate Weather Local GPS

comment: While made for Android wear devices, Aeris also excels at  providing basic weather info.
title: Excellent all-around weather app.

author: David Chapman
comment: Excellent weather app that I use primarily on my Huawei watch.  Many watch faces with customization and alerts.  The phone  app is excellent as well.

author: AKIS A.
comment: Clear presentation even on watch. Please update the app to synchronize through WiFi when i am out of bluetooth range.

author: Megan Hammond
comment: set to update cards every 30 minutes but always days out of date.
title: doesnt update

author: Philip Hake
comment: Works great with Android Wear. I also like the alerts and the live radar.
title: Works great I love the life radar

author: Rob Crowe
comment: This is the best weather app for Android wear. Love the satellite snap shot the best

author: Imaaround
comment: Great interface everything in one weather app.
title: Weather watch it..

author: Mark Ward
comment: This is the best weather app I've found for the Moto 360.
title: Moto 360

author: Jeff Strickland
comment: Love how it works and looks on my watch
title: Nice app

author: bert wengenroth
comment: Moto 360
title: Love it

author: Darren Wynard
comment: I really like this weather app, the presentation is clear and the weather forecast seems to be reliable enough. It's lovely to be able to look at the weather on my Moto 360. The icons could be a tiny bit bigger when displayed on the watch in week view and Celsius displayed with mph for UK dwellers would be a helpful addition, but these are minor points. Overall this is a smashing little weather app.
title: Lovely app!

author: Yn Pragne
comment: The radar and satellite cards are nicely done which is why I originally installed the app. I uninstalled it once I realized that the cards aren't formatted for a round watch face so the corner text gets cut off (you'll notice on the images provided, only the radar is shown on a round watch). Also, the Pro version only changes the cards and the card order on the watch notifications. You can't change the order of the cards as they appear in the watch app itself.

author: Fred T.
comment: With such a decent looking app on the phone why isn't there a widget? You even have a decent radar. Some other apps have a widget but no radar. So unbalanced on the options for users in the store. It is realized that this app is primarily focused for Android wear but again it seems like enough thought and time went into the actual phone app, why not add the updatable widget?
title: No widget for phone.

author: Lindsay Bosel
comment: I just want to open the weather on my Samsung Gear Live and it gives me a message that it can't connect to my device. Very frustrating since I'm holding my phone in my hand. Ugh.
title: Gear Live :(

author: Tommy Bertken
comment: I love the radar feature, but the other features aren't really built for a round watch face. Some of the info at the corners gets chopped off. Otherwise perfect app. Edit: Fixed
title: Not built for round screens

author: Brett Salling
comment: Love it, but I have a small problem. I don't want to receive notifications on my smart watch from the app, but whenever I disable them, they keep coming back for some reason.
title: Love the app
